title: [Large-scale] Evidence-Based Basic Life Support (BLS) Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Concepts and Emergency Response Experience
context.additional_context: Customized BLS training for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields. Implementing a blended learning environment using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can apply standard BLS procedures (30:2 compression-to-ventilation ratio) to adult cardiac arrest patients within 3 minutes.
Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in performing chest compressions with a depth of at least 5 cm during manikin simulation training.
Learners can demonstrate the procedure for using an automated external defibrillator (AED) with over 90% accuracy.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
